Author: shoobe01

Comment: I don't know. It's curious, maybe it's like you say and it was just tradition that kept everyone in their own area of influence. They will likely say that the mayor was just detained and not arrested officially. It's spooky to me bc either they are being told from higher ups to keep observers out or else they are doing things that are improper. It's likely the later.   Jails are hugely expensive to furnish and not at all straight forward fixtures, so much so that it's nearly impossible to retrofit an existing building for detention. So my guess would be dog kennels and waste buckets, and they are trying to hide it from any oversight. Or they don't want anyone to be able to ID the inmates or get an accurate count.  The New York cops have put people in temporary detention in whare houses before. No plumbing, concrete floor. They did it after some protest that happened. That's likely what is going on, they want to sneak out some of the over crowding, hide the code violations and keep anyone from being able to talk to the inmates at all.
Author: FastidiousLizard261
